results.title: ‘Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness’ Review: Nothing Out of the Ordinary
results.abstract: Benedict Cumberbatch returns for some more mystic Marvel mumbo-jumbo, though Sam Raimi manages to inject a sense of horror every now and then.
des_facet: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Xochitl Gomez, left, Benedict Wong and Benedict Cumberbatch in the newest “Doctor Strange” entry.

results.title: What to Know Before Seeing ‘Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness’
results.abstract: Why do Wanda Maximoff and our title hero seem to be zombies, and what is the Darkhold? Here’s a rundown and a viewing guide to help.

results.title: In France, a Film Has Women Sharing Their Stories of Abortion
results.abstract: Following the release of “Happening,” about an illegal abortion in 1963, the country’s contemporary stigma around the procedure is facing scrutiny.

multimedia.caption: Anamaria Vartolomei, left, and Sandrine Bonnaire in “Happening.” The movie won the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival.
Anamaria Vartolomei, left, and Sandrine Bonnaire in “Happening.” The movie won the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival.
Anamaria Vartolomei, left, and Sandrine Bonnaire in “Happening.” The movie won the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival.

results.title: Cate Blanchett and Cindy Sherman: Secrets of the Camera Chameleons
results.abstract: On the 45th anniversary of Sherman’s acclaimed series “Untitled Film Stills,” they toured her show, discussing what an image, or a smile, may reveal.

multimedia.caption: “It’s interesting, you go through this process by yourself,” Blanchett told Sherman. “I’m not a great fan of the monologue.”
multimedia.copyright: Camila Falquez for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Spring Awakening: Those You’ve Known’ Review: Rock ’n’ Roll High School
results.abstract: This film about the hit 2006 musical is a sure-handed blend of making-of explainer, theater-kid scrapbook, and jukebox documentary.

results.abstract: A sister tries to persuade a sibling that her life is worth living.

results.abstract: Looking for something new to watch? Here’s a roundup of the most promising titles coming to most major U.S. streaming services (except Netflix) this month.

results.title: Johnny Depp Lost $22.5 Million ‘Pirates’ Role After Op-Ed, Manager Says
results.abstract: Mr. Depp’s talent manager said the actor had been up to play Captain Jack Sparrow again until his ex-wife, Amber Heard, wrote an op-ed saying she was a “public figure representing domestic abuse.”

multimedia.caption: Johnny Depp’s lawsuit against his ex-wife, Amber Heard, asserts that his career was damaged by an op-ed she wrote for The Washington Post.
Johnny Depp’s lawsuit against his ex-wife, Amber Heard, asserts that his career was damaged by an op-ed she wrote for The Washington Post.

results.title: ‘Randy Rhoads: Reflections of a Guitar Icon’ Review: Beyond ‘Crazy Train’
results.abstract: Forty years after Rhoads’s death, small rock venues across the nation still host tribute shows honoring him. This new documentary explains why.

results.title: Bill Murray Speaks About ‘Insensitive’ Behavior on ‘Being Mortal’ Set
results.abstract: “I did something I thought was funny, and it wasn’t taken that way,” he said in a television interview on Saturday.

multimedia.caption: Murray labeled the episode a “difference of opinion” and said he had been dwelling on what happened for the past week or more.

results.title: Catherine Spaak, Darling of Italian Cinema in the ’60s, Dies at 77
results.abstract: Born in France, she moved to Italy as a teenager and began a long acting career, which extended to Hollywood in the movie “Hotel.”

multimedia.caption: Catherine Spaak in 2007. As a young actress she became something of a sex symbol, often cast as a mistress or, in one case, as “a restless young widow.”
Catherine Spaak in 2007. As a young actress she became something of a sex symbol, often cast as a mistress or, in one case, as “a restless young widow.”

results.title: Review: In a New ‘Macbeth,’ Something Wonky This Way Comes
results.abstract: Daniel Craig and Ruth Negga star in Sam Gold’s oddly uneasy take on the Scottish play.

results.title: Julia Roberts no ha cambiado. Pero Hollywood sí
results.abstract: La estrella habla de su papel en “Gaslit” con Sean Penn, de su regreso a las comedias románticas después de 20 años y revela algo sobre su icónica sonrisa.

results.title: Jacques Perrin, Soft-Spoken Film Star and Producer, Is Dead at 80
results.abstract: A French actor, he was a heartthrob in the musical “The Young Girls of Rochefort,” a photojournalist in the thriller “Z” and a jaded director in the hit “Cinema Paradiso.”

multimedia.caption: A weeping Jacques Perrin in the closing scene of “Cinema Paradiso” (1988), his film best known to American audiences.
A weeping Jacques Perrin in the closing scene of “Cinema Paradiso” (1988), his film best known to American audiences.

results.abstract: This month’s picks include demented cultists, zombies with pause buttons, hellish stays at a hotel, an unsettling home share and a killer named Oopsie.

results.title: In Echo of Soviet Era, Russia’s Movie Theaters Turn to Pirate Screenings
results.abstract: In a Cold War throwback, some venues are showing bootleg versions after Hollywood studios pulled films from the country. Still, viewer numbers have tanked.

multimedia.caption: The Oktyabr movie theater in Moscow. Ticket sales to see films in Russia were reported to have fallen by about half in March, compared with the same period last year.
The Oktyabr movie theater in Moscow. Ticket sales to see films in Russia were reported to have fallen by about half in March, compared with the same period last year.
The Oktyabr movie theater in Moscow. Ticket sales to see films in Russia were reported to have fallen by about half in March, compared with the same period last year.

results.title: Watch Alexander Skarsgard Battle the Undead in ‘The Northman’
results.abstract: The director Robert Eggers narrates a scene that pits the star against a most unfriendly zombie.

results.title: Stream These Three Great Documentaries
results.abstract: This month’s nonfiction picks include one about uncovering a treasure trove of silent films and one that aims to uncover the methods of Kenny G.

multimedia.caption: Louise Lovely in “The Social Buccaneer,” one of hundreds of silent films that were buried in Dawson City, Yukon, and discovered decades later. They are the subject of the documentary “Dawson City: Frozen Time.”

results.title: Where’d All the Method Acting Go?
results.abstract: The Method taught actors to channel the complexity and messiness of human emotion into a performance. Why is that so hard to find in the movies today?
results.byline: By Wesley Morris, Elyssa Dudley, Hans Buetow and Sasha Weiss

results.abstract: A mysterious artist and a love triangle are at the center of this high-school comedy, which can’t quite decide whether to be preposterous or sincere.

results.title: ‘Anaïs in Love’ Review: Portrait of a Woman on the Run
results.abstract: A restless woman discovers herself in a seductive French romance that throws out the usual dusty script about women, desire and pleasure.

results.title: It Took Me 40 Years to Watch the Movie ‘Diva.’ It Was Worth the Wait.
results.abstract: At a friend’s urging, our critic saw the “mondo chic” 1981 film by the French director Jean-Jacques Beineix, ahead of a revival. He was thrilled.

multimedia.caption: Wilhelmenia Fernandez portrays an opera singer in “Diva,” from 1981, which was directed by Jean-Jacques Beineix.
